item.description:
Notes: This folder should be placed below "HAPI:Token" folder.

TODO: To test authorization using cookie, you need to do the followings:
1. In browser window: Log into CMS site using an authorized user 
2. Open Dev tool > Application tab > Cookies menu > select URL > get ".AspNet.ApplicationCookie" cookie value
3. In Postman: Set the cookie value above to global variable "appCookie"
4. Set "HAPI:authType" environment variable to "cookie"
5. Run the collection

item.description:
Testing story NCD-971
Note: endpoint for testing ContentTypeApi
{{cmsUrl}}/api/contentmanagement/v1/contenttypes

_ for testing Content Delivery API (Headless API)
_ all GET requests must have Authorization Type as "Bearer Token" with Token as {{HAPI:token}}

To test authorization using cookie, you need to do the followings:
1. In browser window: Log into CMS site using an user having sufficient permissions to contents
2. Open Dev tool > Application tab > Cookies menu > select site URL > get ".AspNet.ApplicationCookie" cookie value
3. In Postman: Set the cookie value above to environment variable "appCookie"
4. Change "HAPI:authType" environment variable to "cookie"
5. Run the collection (notes: the cookie is created by the request "get StartPage using cookie")

ContentApi custom settings for automation tests:
    .SetSiteDefinitionApiEnabled(true)
    .SetMultiSiteFilteringEnabled(false) 
    .SetForceAbsolute(true)
    .SetIncludeSiteHosts(true)
    .SetIncludeInternalContentRoots(true)
    .SetIncludeMasterLanguage(true)
    .SetMinimumRoles(string.Empty)
    .SetRequiredRole(string.Empty)

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n

EPiServer.ContentApi.Core","Value$$string":"

Huntsville AL February 8, 2012

\n

Alloy Technologies, the leader in collaborative project management, today announced that the World Wildlife Fund has used Alloy Technologies to improve the success rate of complex five nation resource efforts. The use of Alloy Meet, Alloy Plan, and Alloy Track has helped save over 200 polar bears in the project spanning Canada, Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia.

\n
